result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

4:31 PM Defendant Hunter R Marver appeared by phone. Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 
No identified victims. 
Deft qualifies for a public defender but deft was unable to get ahold of anyone at their office.
Court gives PTC & SC w/JA dates.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling conference on November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:36 AM  Prosecuting attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hunter R Marver appeared by phone. Defendant does not qualify for a public defender.  Defendant has picked up the paperwork for a court appointed atty. Defendant does have an employer but hasn't started yet. Court contacts the Public Defender's office to find out why the defendant doesn't qualify. Public Defender's office on the conference line, defendant will qualify-as he is not employed at this moment. Court instructed the defendant to call the PD's office today.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 04:30 pm.

8:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam T. Stuart in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hunter R Marver in court. 
Both parties appeared by phone. 
Court never received paperwork back from Deft, Deft stated the paperwork was confusing.
Court refers deft to the Public Defenders office. 
Deft states he didn't qualify for a Public Defender the last time but will try again. 
Bailiff provides deft w/phone number of PDs office. 
Deft updates address.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
